ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But We will drive the evildoers to Hell, like cattle to a watering hole.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And drive the wicked into Hell like cattle driven to water,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and We shall drive the guilty ones to Hell as a thirsty herd.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and the criminals will be driven and thrown into hell,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And drive the guilty towards hell, thirsty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We shall drive the criminals to Hell, in a thirsty state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We will drive the guilty to hell thirsty
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and drive the evildoers into Gehenna herding,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And drive the guilty unto hell, a weary herd,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and We shall drive the sinful like a thirsty herd into Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And shall drive the culprits to Hell as a herd. *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and drive the guilty as a thirsty herd towards hell,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We shall drive the Mujrimun (polytheists, sinners, criminals, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, etc.) to Hell, in a thirsty state (like a thirsty herd driven down to water),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and drive the evildoers as herds, into Gehenna
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And herd the sinners into hell, like animals to water.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:86] and drive the guilty, [guilty] on account of their disbelief, into Hell, a thirsty herd (wirdan, the [accusative] plural of wārid, meaning ‘one who is thirsty and on foot).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And drive the guilty) the idolaters (unto hell, a weary herd) in a state of thirst,
